item.title: Automatic security updates with Ubuntu
item.description: To configure automatic updates on Ubuntu you will first need ensure that the unattended-upgrades package is installed. sudo apt-get install unattended-upgrades We then need to enable the package by running the following command (you will be prompted with a confirmation screen - select yes): sudo dpkg-reconfigure -plow unattended-upgrades Once enabled, edit the auto upgrades settings file (/etc/apt/apt.conf.d/20auto-upgrades) so it contains the following 4 lines (some may already exist):
